h2.div: Need help with your Chrome Book? Get help from the IT guys at itdept@bmcsd.org.

div.class: hJDwNd-AhqUyc-uQSCkd jXK9ad D2fZ2 OjCsFc wHaque GNzUNc

div.jsaction: touchstart:UrsOsc; click:KjsqPd; focusout:QZoaZ; mouseover:y0pDld; mouseout:dq0hvd;fv1Rjc:jbFSOd;CrfLRd:SzACGe;

h3.div: Kindergarten and PreK screening that was scheduled for April 28-30, has been postponed at this time. Questions can be directed to Karen Armstrong @ karmstrong@bmcsd.org.

div.jsaction: touchstart:UrsOsc; click:KjsqPd; focusout:QZoaZ; mouseover:y0pDld; mouseout:dq0hvd;fv1Rjc:jbFSOd;CrfLRd:SzACGe;

h3.div: Please be advised that will not be doing any new student registrations until May 16th. PreK and Kindergarten registrations for the 2020-2021 school year can email the forms to Karen Armstrong at karmstrong@bmcsd.org.

div.jsaction: touchstart:UrsOsc; click:KjsqPd; focusout:QZoaZ; mouseover:y0pDld; mouseout:dq0hvd;fv1Rjc:jbFSOd;CrfLRd:SzACGe;

h3.div: If you would like a Board Petition, please call or email, Christina Dufrane, Board Clerk, at 518-529-7342 ext. 1104 or at cdufrane@bmcsd.org. We will mail or email a petition to you.

div.class: hJDwNd-AhqUyc-uQSCkd jXK9ad D2fZ2 OjCsFc wHaque GNzUNc

div.class: hJDwNd-AhqUyc-uQSCkd jXK9ad D2fZ2 OjCsFc wHaque GNzUNc

p.strong: A message from Todd LaPage, Superintendent of Schools

div.p: At this time, there are no confirmed cases of coronavirus in our county. However, with support from Franklin County Public Health Department and Franklin County declaration of a State of Emergency. We are joining with many other area school districts and cancelling classes for students effective, Monday March 16- May 15, 2020. School will resume on May 16th

Given that this is a rapidly evolving public health issue, we feel closing school is the most proactive and prudent action available to us. This closure is designed to help limit the spread of illness.
We will provide information on how we support instruction and meals during this time of closures.
All employees are to report to work Monday and Tuesday and follow your regularly scheduled hours. Please check your e-mail today for additional information.
In the end, it will be impossible to know if we overreacted or did too much, but it will be QUITE apparent if we under reacted, or did too little.
Thank you for your patience and understanding as we deal with this challenging situation.
